ghostPost.title: Where's the dashboard?
ghostPost.excerpt: The dashboard was an early prototype idea for Ghost which was retired in 2015 after determining that it was not viable.
ghostPost.meta_description: The dashboard was an early prototype idea for Ghost which was retired in 2015 after determinng that it was not viable.
ghostPost.plaintext:
The dashboard was an early prototype idea for Ghost which was retired in 2015
after determining that it was not viable.

As we started looking into the viability and complexity of building a
comprehensive analytics dashboard which would pull all your relevant site
metrics into one place we came across more questions than answers.

All the paths we explored ended in creating a bad product. So in the end we had
to decide between shipping something below our standards (and then suffering
through maintaining it for the rest of time) â€“ or letting the idea go. We opted
for the latter. The dashboard was a lovely, but ultimately impractical idea!

Fortunately, though, you can still make the dashboard yourself really easily
usingGeckoboard [https://geckoboard.com], which is a fully thought-out,
feature-complete product (with a team over 3x the size of Ghost's).

The original Ghost dashboard concept, recreated in Geckoboard
[https://share.geckoboard.com/dashboards/DGMZGZVU62VIFKGA]Here's more
information about using Geckoboard and Ghost
[https://docs.ghost.org/integrations/geckoboard/]  together.
ghostPost.html:
The dashboard was an early prototype idea for Ghost which was retired in 2015 after determining that it was not viable.

As we started looking into the viability and complexity of building a comprehensive analytics dashboard which would pull all your relevant site metrics into one place we came across more questions than answers.

All the paths we explored ended in creating a bad product. So in the end we had to decide between shipping something below our standards (and then suffering through maintaining it for the rest of time) â€“ or letting the idea go. We opted for the latter. The dashboard was a lovely, but ultimately impractical idea!

Fortunately, though, you can still make the dashboard yourself really easily using Â Geckoboard, which is a fully thought-out, feature-complete product (with a team over 3x the size of Ghost's).

Here's more information about using Geckoboard and Ghost together.
